title.narrative: WASH OP 3 - SUSTAINABLE ACCESS TO SAFE WATER

description.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met

description.narrative: UNICEF Madagascar continued to support the Government, working with other partners in the sector,;in improving access to water in rural communities. As a result,;94,880;community members;of;which 50% are children have access to safe drinking water through the construction and rehabilitation of small water networks,;and;boreholes;equipped with hand pumps. UNICEF developed substantial actions to increase water infrastructure and the community&39;s resilience to climate change.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
